title: All communications between Fragments must go via an Activity. Fragments
CANNOT
b
communicate with each other without an Activity.

inline_content.Text: All communications between Fragments must go via an Activity. Fragments
communicate with each other without an Activity.

title: In this sample, we have a
MainActivity
c
that hosts two fragments,
SenderFragment
c
and
ReceiverFragment
c
, for sending and receiving a
message
c
(a simple String in this case) respectively.

inline_content.Text: In this sample, we have a
(a simple String in this case) respectively.

title: A Button in
SenderFragment
c
initiates the process of sending the message. A TextView in the
ReceiverFragment
c
is updated when the message is received by it.

inline_content.Text: initiates the process of sending the message. A TextView in the
is updated when the message is received by it.

title: Following is the snippet for the MainActivity with comments explaining the important lines of code:

inline_content.Text: Following is the snippet for the MainActivity with comments explaining the important lines of code:

title: The layout file for the
MainActivity
c
hosts two fragments inside a LinearLayout :

inline_content.Text: hosts two fragments inside a LinearLayout :

title:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:id="@+id/activity_main"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    android:paddingBottom="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
    android:paddingLeft="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
    android:paddingRight="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
    android:paddingTop="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
    tools:context="com.naru.fragmentcommunication.MainActivity">

<fragment
    android:id="@+id/fragment_sender"
    android:name="com.naru.fragmentcommunication.SenderFragment"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="0dp"
    android:layout_weight="1"
    tools:layout="@layout/fragment_sender" />

<fragment
    android:id="@+id/fragment_receiver"
    android:name="com.naru.fragmentcommunication.ReceiverFragment"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="0dp"
    android:layout_weight="1"
    tools:layout="@layout/fragment_receiver" />
</LinearLayout>

content_resolved.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:id="@+id/activity_main"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    android:paddingBottom="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
    android:paddingLeft="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
    android:paddingRight="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
    android:paddingTop="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
    tools:context="com.naru.fragmentcommunication.MainActivity">

<fragment
    android:id="@+id/fragment_sender"
    android:name="com.naru.fragmentcommunication.SenderFragment"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="0dp"
    android:layout_weight="1"
    tools:layout="@layout/fragment_sender" />

<fragment
    android:id="@+id/fragment_receiver"
    android:name="com.naru.fragmentcommunication.ReceiverFragment"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="0dp"
    android:layout_weight="1"
    tools:layout="@layout/fragment_receiver" />
</LinearLayout>

title: Following is the code snippet for the
SenderFragment
c
explaining the important lines of code:

inline_content.Text: Following is the code snippet for the
explaining the important lines of code:

title:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:gravity="center"
    android:orientation="vertical">

<Button
    android:id="@+id/bSend"
    android:layout_width="wrap_content"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:text="SEND"
    android:layout_gravity="center_horizontal" />
</LinearLayout>

content_resolved.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:gravity="center"
    android:orientation="vertical">

<Button
    android:id="@+id/bSend"
    android:layout_width="wrap_content"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:text="SEND"
    android:layout_gravity="center_horizontal" />
</LinearLayout>

title: The
ReceiverFragment
c
is simple and exposes a simple public method to updates its TextView. When the
MainActivity
c
receives the message from the
SenderFragment
c
it calls this public method of the
ReceiverFragment
c

title: Following is the code snippet for the
ReceiverFragment
c
with comments explaining the important lines of code :

inline_content.Text: Following is the code snippet for the
with comments explaining the important lines of code :

title:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:gravity="center"
    android:orientation="vertical">
<TextView
    android:id="@+id/tvReceivedMessage"
    android:layout_width="wrap_content"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content"
    android:text="Waiting for message!" />
</LinearLayout>
